entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 3:49PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Flooding Possible on the Tanana River Starting Monday... Glacial rivers draining the Alaska Range such as the Tanana, Chisana, and Nabesna Rivers are running near bankfull. This is due to hot temperatures causing significant high elevation snow melt in the Alaska Range. Significant rainfall expected over the southeast Interior over the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued July 09 at 2:39PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory is in effect... * SURF...Surfs of 10 to 12 feet will continue to impact south and east facing shores due to a large southerly swell and moderate to fresh tradewinds. * TIMING...through the new week * IMPACTS...strong rip currents and large surfs.

entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Rough waters with waves of 4 to 7 feet and strong currents. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Door County. * WHEN...From Sunday evening through Monday morning.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 12:02AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern West Virginia, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 9:53PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and southeast West Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Giles. In southeast West Virginia, Mercer, Monroe and Summers. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT.
